## indexBy() function

Returns the spilted lists grouped by index. They key should be unique and for ununique keys it would be replaced with the last key.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function indexBy<T extends {
    [K in keyof T]: string | number | symbol;
}, K extends keyof T>(array: T[], key: K): Record<T[K], T>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  array | T\[\] | of objects. |
|  key | K | unique key |

<b>Returns:</b>

Record&lt;T\[K\], T&gt;

grouped by index, key value list.

## Example


```ts
indexBy([
 { id: 1, name: "A" },
 { id: 2, name: "B" },
 { id: 3, name: "C" },
 ], 'id')
 // result:
 // {
 //  "1": { id: 1, name: "A" },
 //  "2": { id: 2, name: "B" },
 //  "3": { id: 3, name: "C" },
 // }
 indexBy([
 { id: 1, name: "A" },
 { id: 1, name: "B" },
 { id: 3, name: "C" },
 ], 'id')
 // result:
 // {
 //  "1": { id: 1, name: "B" },
 //  "3": { id: 3, name: "C" },
 // }
```
